byline.contributor: Matt Flegenheimer and Ashley Parker contributed reporting from South Carolina, and Maggie Haberman from New York.
byline.original: By JEREMY W. PETERS and JONATHAN MARTIN

abstract: South Carolina Gov Nikki R Haley, at rally in Chapin, SC, endorses Sen Marco Rubio for Republican nomination for president; endorsement could give Rubio crucial boost in polls three days before state's presidential primary; move also highlights how these politicians, who are both 44 and children of immigrants, are together hoping to offer contrast to older generation of Republican political leaders.

headline.print_headline: Haley Backs Rubio and Vision of a G.O.P. ‘to Win the Future’
headline.main: Nikki Haley Endorses Marco Rubio, Aiming to Project Vibrant New G.O.P.

snippet: Together, Mr. Rubio, the son of Cuban immigrants, and Ms. Haley, the daughter of Sikh immigrants from India, hope to form a powerful contrast to an older generation of Republicans who have long controlled the party.
lead_paragraph: Together, Mr. Rubio, the son of Cuban immigrants, and Ms. Haley, the daughter of Sikh immigrants from India, hope to form a powerful contrast to an older generation of Republicans who have long controlled the party.
